Reviews.Content: "Loved it - can't wait to be back' The best thing about this hotel is its location - its right on Legion Beach, has a double level infinity pool which is gorgeous, lined with lounges and is the perfect place to lounge about on a lazy afternoon with a book and a cocktail or post breakfast. We were looking for a peaceful location, so this hotel was perfect for us and just a stone's throw away from small shops and restaurants. However, if you prefer to be in the middle of the action (E.g. something equivalent to Baga beach in Goa, India) then perhaps you should choose a hotel in Kuta which is about 10 mins by cab from Legion Beach. We stayed in a junior suite which was tasteful but minimistic in its decor. We loved the huge LCD television in our room which we used at night to watch movies! The staff and hotel employees were extremely warm and cordial and attended to our every need - they got really excited to know that we were Hindus. The hotel also has a wonderful spa (slightly expensive though) where we enjoyed a one hour aroma body massage. Breakfast is buffet and comprises a reasonable good spread and is served poolside facing the beach! Among the drawbacks - (1) the junior suites have small porches with deck chairs and a table where one can enjoy a smoke or drink at night (the concept is good) - however it is difficult to sit here due to the mosquitoes so it is advisable that one carry a mosquito repellant/anti-mosquito cream with them for the trip (2) mosquitoes can also be a problem if one leaves their room/suite door open in the evening/night.The room service menu is quite good and has a variety of food - I strongly recommend the thai prawn with flat noodles. Besides the minor drawbacks above, we completely enjoyed our stay at the hotel and look forward to returning soon.
Reviews.Author: Em_India

Reviews.Content: Bali Niksoma - overall a happy time       Lounge room of Suite room
Reviews.Author: Grrltrip

Reviews.Content: can't wait to go back to the Bali Niksoma!       the entrance to the openair reception
Reviews.Author: regcam

Reviews.Content: An oasis to strip your normal life away My partner and I first discovered the Niksoma in November 05, and spent two weeks walking around in a loved up, blown away, magical daze. We return every single November and have booked another two weeks this coming November - in short, this place is the penultimate. The gardens are lush and perfectly designed and maintained, the staff are delightful and truly remember you if you're a repeat visitor. Your coffee cup is attended to every morning at the delicious buffet breakfast, refilled with a smile by staff with service levels we'll never see in Australia.Our first visit was in a junior suite, a bungalow style room on the ground floor with the most enormous bathroom I'd ever experienced in fifteen years of travelling to Bali.In 2006, we upped it and stayed in a Suite - a deluxe apartment style room full of space and design and with views of the pool and ocean so close you felt you could jump into the pool!2007 also saw us in a Suite on the second level, up and out of the way of people walking past your room giving an immense sense of privacy.The Niksoma is not for families, not because kids wouldn't love it there, but because the hotel should really cater for couples and twenty-thirty somethings, allowing them to relax and enjoy the atmosphere in peace.So grab a daybed by the pool overlooking the ocean, and watch all the people walking by, wishing they were staying at the Niksoma!
Reviews.Author: Marika_G

Reviews.Content: Just what was needed - Great Location, Breakfast and Pool       One of the day beds
Reviews.Author: Moscow_traveller

Reviews.Content: FORGET IT: Service level, staff behaviours, room price We just back from Bali, we would like to share with you a very bad experience. We spent only one night and trust me, NO MORE.The nightmare started from the beginning when we push the door. The lady at the front desk was simply not nice at all... Maybe she was thinking, we were not good enough due to our dress code, who can not afford her hotel... Just imagine 2 persons in vacation, relaxed.That s a pity for her, we are used to spend time in hotels all over the world (WW, Intercontinental, Carlton , SLH) trust us this hotel is very far from the international standards compare to its cost, 185 USD$ for a superior double room !Let s go to the room description: decoration finishing, room maintenance do not exist. The room seems to be under renovation.We do not speak about the bathroom which was not clean at all. Frankly speaking, it should cost 80-100 USD max !Services:The housekeeping, the waiters of the restaurant are not professional. They went into the room to clean it whereas we required not to be disturbed.The food in the restaurant is ok. But the service is not good at all. You should see the way the waiter cleaned the table, it was a joke. He did know anything about wine...FORGET IT, do not go there, the hotel is in the badest area in Kuta. We went to Le Meridien the day before, a paradise before the HELL.
Reviews.Author: Tournessol

Reviews.Content: A Fantastic Hotel And Wonderful Staff My partner and I stayed at the Niksoma for 9 nights.What a lovely smaller property compared to others we have stayed at in the past. Location fantastic could walk to all our favorite restaurants and shopping spots together with close proximity to some great waves.Cannot praise the staff of the Niksoma enough, just wonderful, warm people who always did whatever they could to ensure we had everything we needed.Would definatley recommend this hotel to couples and families.
Reviews.Author: JessicaSydney

Reviews.Content: Great Choice ! Rooms: Our family of 4 stayed for 8 nights in 2 standard rooms. The rooms themselves were kept spotlessly clean throughout our stay and any problems that arose were quickly addressed by very friendly staff. The bathrooms need some rennovations as the tilework is not finished off, otherwise ok. The rooms are cleaned everyday and our package included free breakfasts and 1 piece of laundry / room / day which was very handy. At night the new sheets are turned down and they also spray for mosquitos in the room . A little cake is left beside your bed and it was a lovely touch.Pool: 2 pools.. both excellent and the views are magnificent as you are right on the beach...( this hotel has the best location !) clean towels are given whenever requested and the pool staff are very attentive.Food: We found the breakfast buffet very good indeed..it had lots of variety. We had lunch around the pool most days and the quality was excellent compared to other places we had tried along the strip.Staff in general...I can honesly say I have never come across such genuinely lovely staff in all my travels..the front desk staff would go out of their way to organize taxis, recommend restaurants , book restaurants etc...where ever you went in this hotel you were always greeted with the nicest , friendlies smiles and greetings ( even the ground staff ).All in all we would have no hesitation in going back...WELL DONE NIKSOMA for making our family holiday so wonderful....Andrew  Carolyn H
Reviews.Author: lanose

Reviews.Content: Treated Like Royalty My mother and I stayed at the Niksoma in 2006 + 2007- both the September holidays.When our driver dropped us off, driving through the dirty little alleyway, we were horrified. But, once we got to the beachfront, we were ABSOLUTELY blown away!It was stunning.I cannot put into words how friendly the staff was-We were treated like royalty. The staff are like our family now. Even the security guards shared conversations with us, every time we entered and exited the hotel. After our first time staying there, we went back the next year. The man at the front desk said Oh Hello, You've returned, welcome back. HE REMEMBERED US.This stay was UNFORGETTABLE!HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
Reviews.Author: x_F_x

Reviews.Content: A liitle slice of heaven My 16 year old daughter and I recently spent 4 nights at this beautiful hotel. The hotel and pool area are simply stunning, the views across to the ocean breath taking. We were very happy with our deluxe room which was clean, stylish and we loved the little treats left for us, when our beds were turned down at night.For all its beauty I must say the most impessive thing about this hotel is the staff. They were all so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble and amazingly they seemed to know our names which is a lovely touch.I stayed there 3 years ago and was impressed yet will say, after this trip,the Bali Niksoma is even better and I am planning to return in December!
Reviews.Author: Saskia30

Reviews.Content: Not worth the price! Based on the positive reviews written for Bali Niksoma, I stayed there with my hubby for 1 night. We had booked 4 nights at USD 195 nett per night but checked out immediately the next morning cos I was very disappointed with the hotel for the price I paid!On my last trip there, I had paid USD180 nett for a 1 bedroom villa at the Kayana, which was fabulous. This time round, we wanted to stay near the beach, which was why I picked Niksoma. But boy, was I disappointed... We chose a Junior Suite at Niksoma. On arrival, was initially quite impressed by the pick-up at the airport (paid USD 15 for one-way transfer though). But when we were brought to our ground floor suite (all 4 J Suites are on the ground floor), I was sorely disappointed. The bedroom area was small, and room had a musky smell. Furnishings were old and look like they have not been well-maintained. Bed was rather creaky. Only thing nice about the J Suite is the spacious bathroom. It had 2 vanity tops/basins, and the one I used was clogged. Had to call the technician to come and fix it. The room felt more like a low class bungalow/chalet than a 'junior suite'. It did look like the picture on the website, except that furnishing were old and in need of an overhaul.My husband and I did not sleep well cos the air in the room did not feel 'clean'. Hubby kept sniffing the whole night. Had a blocked nose. Might have been allergic to some dust mites in the room or something. The next day, we decided to shift to another hotel cos we could not imagine staying another 3 nights there. They offered an upgrade to their suite (also on ground floor), but we had already lost confidence in the quality of the rooms, so we declined that. The good thing about the hotel was that they were very accommodating, and allowed us to check out only by paying USD100 as cancellation charges. Would have been USD195, but the supervisor felt rather apologetic for my husband's allergy and hence slashed the amount (without me asking for it). The supervisor also graciously helped me contact a few other hotels in the seminyak area to check for price and availability.We finally settled on Uma Sapna Villas (near Jl Laksmana or Eat Street) for USD160 nett per nite for a 2 bedroom villa with private pool and garden(!!). That was an amazing 'upgrade' at a lower price! We loved Uma Sapna for its price and location. You can check out my reviews on Kayana and Uma Sapna which I have also posted. Overall, though the service staff was helpful, I would NEVER stay at the Bali Niksoma again, not even if it was free! Think they need to do a major overhaul to their rooms and change the furniture and other finishings. But then again, I think reviews are subjective. It all depends on your expectation. If your expectations are high, and you have been exposed to better accommodation, this would be way below standards. Seriously, for the price you pay, you can get top villas (not at beachside though) wth your private pool and garden in the Seminyak/Kuta area. This is just not worth the price.But to be fair to Niksoma, we did take a stroll along the beach, and realised that it is indeed one of the top 3 iclassy hotels in that area - after Anantara and Outrigger O-CE-N, I think.
Reviews.Author: darlenemel

Reviews.Content: This hotel is AMAZING. We had a ball at this hotel. From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out we were just in love with the place. The staff are gracious and there's nothing they won't do for you. Breakfasts are brilliant as is the Niksoma's restaurant all-day-menu. Poolside cocktails were a dream (you can't go past their Mojito!). Our room was magnificent, we were upgraded to a Suite after the first night but the Standard we were in was just as fantastic. The small touches unique to the hotel are wonderful (wait til you try the arrival cocktail on check-in and the nightly sweet the house-staff leave after turning down the bed). The pool area is ultra-clean with amenities close by and and the upper pool feels like it's dissappearing into the ocean. Lots of different styles of furniture to lounge on poolside and attentive, friendly service. Beach directly out the front making for an awesome sunset.Look out for Min, she's the hostess with the mostest and Donni our favourite pool guy (he'll keep you topped up with the complimentary garlic nuts and they are a winner). Not so much for the kids but for couples or groups you cannot go past this place for value, service  style. If you're thinking of spending New Year's Eve in Bali you can't miss the Niksoma's spread either. 25 people worked tirelessly all day to create an atmosphere that was something out of a fairy book. Rave, rave, rave............
Reviews.Author: AussieJazz

Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, amazing staff Wow, what a great hotel. We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our Bali holiday and could not have been happier. It is in a great location on the beach at Legian - a road separates the hotel from the sand, but this is a pedestrian access road only so it is very peaceful.First impressions were wonderful - a great welcome from staff and we were allowed to check in 4 hours earlier than usual time which was fantastic.We had a third floor room with a view of the surf - although there were buildings in front, we could still see the water and the surfers which was great, especially when you look at the other hotel choices along the beach. The pools were great and our 2 kids could not have been happier. The hotel even had noodles for the kids to use in the pool. We loved having lunch on our pool chairs looking out over the water. Great basic lunchtime menu.Despite the hotel being full we never felt overcrowded and could always find a seat at the pool, breakfast etc.We loved the spa - it was quite pricey compared to some others, but it is only to be expected in this type of hotel.The staff were absolutely amazing. They were so welcoming and friendly and helpful and made travelling with young children so easy - they absolutely doted on them and all remembered their names. We felt the staff took time out to chat to us, answer any questions and give us insights into their culture. Do I have any negatives ? Certainly nothing of any consquence. Would probably have been nicer to have more of a mix of nationalities - 90% were Australian like ourselves. We like to be able to meet others from around the world when on holidays. Only other minor one is that it is not really close walking distance to anything other than the street stalls, but taxis are so cheap that this is not a problem at all.LOVED our stay and will be back definately. We know Bali well and this is in our opinion by far the nicest hotel in the area (in this price bracket anyway!)
Reviews.Author: carowilk

Reviews.Content: Bali Niksoma - Relax  This hotel was recommended to us by our Travel Agent and as we had total trust in her and were totally overwhelmed by the choice of hotels in Kuta/Legian we were happy to take her advice. My husband and I stayed here for ten nights and we enjoyed every moment of the experience. Our room was a standard room and we found that it was big enough to accommodate our needs. The hotel is amazingly well kept, the gardens are beautiful, the restaurant immaculate and the pools are amazing. The staff could not do enough for us and were friendly and caring. It took us forty minutes to walk along the beach to the main Kuta area, but with taxi's so cheap we didn't walk very often. We liked being out of the hussle and bussle of Kuta and found where the Niksoma is situated to be restful and relaxing. I used the spa and found it to be good although a little more expensive than other spas that I used while away. The bathrooms are a little dated and could probably do with new towels. The restaurant is certainly not five star but the food was tasty and enjoyable. We would stay there again in a heart beat.
Reviews.Author: byza2329

Reviews.Content: we love the niksoma I have stayed at the Niksoma 4 times. I will be staying again in April 2008. My daughter and i stayed for 10 days. My husband andI for 8 days and with my sister and 2 young children for 10days.I was introduced to the Niksoma by my cousin a travel agent.The Hotel is clean and modern. It has a great location and is never crowded even when its a full house. The breakfast is okand there is enough variety. If you want something that is not atthe buffet just ask and they get it for you. The rooms are always cleaned well and the service is great and always friendly staff.I f i had to say a bad thing it would be the people puting towells on the pool chairs and going out expecting them to be there whenthey get back should be a limit of 30 minutes.I am looking forward to returning to the Niksoma and to see thefriendly faces of the staff on my return. Lyn. Maroubra nsw Australia.
Reviews.Author: lynMaroubra

Reviews.Content: Great Stay Spent three days here in Dec. 2007. Do not like large hotels, aim for the boutiques, so this hotel was perfect. The hotel was a nice intro for first day of first time in Bali. The hotel is right on the beach with two beautiful pools. The beach right infront of the hotel is not overcrowded but it is easy to walk down to the center of Kuta. The food was nice and reasonable at the hotel and within a short walk there are numerous other places to eat. The staff was friendly and helpful. Very cost effective hotel for right on the beach with a nice ocean view during the high season. The room was very pleasant. A very nice stay.
Reviews.Author: ediggidy

Reviews.Content: Go elsewhere Stayed at Niksoma every December for the last 3 years (avg stay = 4 nights). The first time (2005) was exciting, a nice hotel w/ direct access to the beach, nice pools (2 pools to die for), slick designed rooms. Even then, I noticed some problems: a ho-hum breakfast, rooms' finishing  details (ie.chipped paints,etc),and dodgy music at the restaurant  pool (RnB CDs). Wrote a 2 page feedback to the manager afterwards. Stayed on the 3rd floor room.The 2nd visit (2006) was good, but not as exciting, rooms finishing have improved, the rest havent..that's ok, we did enjoy our stay though. By now, the hotel has became a chic place for the hip Jakarta crowds to stay in Bali (it even has a Facebook profile).Stayed on the 2nd floor room.Third visit (Dec 19-21 2007) was the last straw, nothing has improved, the rooms, especially the one on the 2nd floor upward are not well maintained, breakfast has gone worse, me and my wife were awakened by the sound of some construction workers working on the room next to ours 7AM in the morning, was very upset about this. called the front desk so they can stop, it did for 15 minutes before they started to work again. 2PM, had a massage in our room, the working  banging started again, called again to front desk, nothing happened, the banging continued. AC was quite noisy, couldnt get much sleep due this noisy AC.Ended the stay earlier, and then we moved to Ubud (uma ubud www.uma.como.bz), hv been very satisified so far, bfast is excellent, it's located next to Neka Museum (one of the largest art museum in Ubud), and across Nuri' Warung (a cheap warung for locals and tourists with Nasi Goreng and pork ribs to die for).Bottomline: avoid Niksoma until they improve the food and room quality , and you can get a better hotel elsewhere w/ Niksoma' rate (approx. USD160).The good: Niksoma is a walking distance to Zanzibar, which has excellent  cheap breakfast menu, staffs are very friendly but not overbearing, direct access to the beach.

Pool To Die For! Stayed here a few months ago and can i say this hotel is beautifulThe pool is just amazing. Over 2 levels it is peaceful and looks over the ocean. I highly recommend this hotelThe pool service is fantastic and staff friendly. We were kindly suprised by their efficiency, friendlyness and hospitality. Located in a great area you are a short taxi ride / walk from shopping etcI LOVED ITand thought it showed excellent value for money
Reviews.Author: HolidayHoliday86

Reviews.Content: Don't Believe the Hype After a few days at the beautiful Sheraton Laguna in Nusa Dua, we decided to move a bit closer to the action and based on the reviews of the Niksoma booked for 4 days. The room rate, unbelievably, was slightly higher than the Sheraton, even though upon arrival they put us in the type of room which you see all over Bali for a quarter of that price. Dark, poor facilities (including a TV which must have been plucked from a museum) and a small, old fashioned bathroom. The next day we were moved to something better, but still for the money it was poor. The Niksoma is trying be a trendy, clubby kind of place, clearly inspired by the likes of Ku De Ta, but sadly they also get that very wrong. Music is too load, and rather than cool relaxing tunes you end up with Gonna Make You Sweat blaring out as you try to have a peaceful breakfast. And the breakfast itself is nothing to get excited about.Service was very average, with many of the staff clearly being too young and too experienced. Some of them couldn't even communicate in English, which obviously for Bali is poor.My advice? Come to Bali, and spend some time in the Sheraton or a similar 5 star hotel, or spend the (not much) extra on a villa hotel like the Elysian or Villa Jodie. Otherwise get the same rooms as the Niksoma (probably with better service) down the road at the Puri Raja or Kumala Pantai for half the price.
Reviews.Author: jeremyk2

Reviews.Content: Perfect... The Niksoma staff are very attentive and friendly without being overbearing. The pools are clean and the temperature is great. The rooms are divine, but the deluxe isn't worth the extra price since the standard room is quite similar. The breakfast is good. The spa is ok but the Bali Botanica Spa in Ubud, which we'd visited prior to moving to Legian, was much better. The location is great for shopping or going to Seminyak or Kuta. WOuld definitely stay there again!!
Reviews.Author: eliza_mdw

Reviews.Content: Amazing experience We stayed in one of the junior suites for two nights during July. The room itself was amazing and looked exactly the same as on the hotel's website. It was very modern and well decorated and the bathroom very big! I also had a look at the deluxe rooms and would recommend paying extra for a deluxe room or junior suite. The hotel is opposite the beach and has a very nice swimming pool. The breakfast was very good. We also had dinner at the hotel one evening and it was one of the best meals that I have ever had. The staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasant and nothing was too much trouble for them. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!
Reviews.Author: Liz27

Reviews.Content: Brilliant We chose this hotel based on the reviews here on tripadvisor. The rooms needed a little bit of updating, but other than that - there are no complaints from these travellers.The staff we ultra helpful, ringing around and assisting us with our next travel move. Very friendly around the pool, always happy for a chat, but not obtrusive.I loved the road out the front with no cars, uninterrupted views of the beach and very few hawkers.Breakfast was filling and the prices for cocktails (let's face it, that's the most important thing!) was fair.I couldn't recommend this highly enough. It was a great experience.It's not five star, but neither are the prices!Just a word, don't bother with their spa - as in most hotels, it's overpriced and the staff don't really quite get what a massage or body scrub is supposed to be. They tried though.Definitely be happy to recommend this.
Reviews.Author: panfarfan

Reviews.Content: Great place,food,staff,experience This was our 9th trip to bali(husband surf nut) have stayed at numerous differant hotels, resorts etc mostly larger in size. We were so impressed by the niksoma the size of the complex is just right. The pool area is fantastic and no swim up pool bar bonus!!! dont get the traveller who sits in the pool bar (sunken) all day and night and doesnt leave(no bathroom breaks) The staff we found fantastic,, helpful, fun could not do enough for us Was a bit disappointed with the size of the rooms we booked a superior room and found they werent much differant to the standard room .only alot more expensive.i thought that they might have been a bit more luxurious. The position of the hotel is the best 15mins one way along the beach and you are in kuta and 15mins the other direction and you have the best resturants in seminyak, and some of the best shopping available. we are going back this october for three weeks cant wait
Reviews.Author: ivy13

Reviews.Content: Average Hotel We have just returned from Bali Niksoma where we stayed for 4 days. We booked this hotel due to the rave reviews it received on Tripdvisor but we felt it didn't really live up to our expectations. We travel alot trying and try to stay in small boutique style hotels. This hotel has a sleek reception and restaurant area but I feel the rooms didn't live up to our expectations. We booked a standard room because we felt by looking at the photos of both standard and deluxe there wasn't very much of a difference. After checking in you get the usual cold towel and welcome drink and we were taken to our room. The standard room was at the far side of the complex and looked like it was an old building which didn't really fit in with the rest of the rooms. Our room was on the first floor where you has to walk past a grotty cupboard where the maids keep there amenities. The maids trolley remained at the bottom of the stairs the whole duration. The room was dark and basic, the furniture was fine but the decor needed updating. The bedroom could have done with a lick of paint. The bathroom was extremely disappointing - grotty tiles, mould developing on the shower curtain, old towels and not of a standard you would expect from a boutique hotel. A few of the suites had little privacy as they were on the main walkway to reception. The pool area was fine but certainly no wow factor - nothing special and it took ages to get any drinks. Overall the common areas are stylish but it doesn't reach to the standard rooms. The staff were very friendly. It had quite a package holiday feel to it and I could have been in Spain rather than thousands of miles away - not what I expected.Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Kaype

Reviews.Content: Unbeatable pool Just returned from 5 days and nights in Bali and staying at the Niksoma. The term 'sleek' is applies.Overall very pleased. The pool was absolutely beautiful and loved being able to order food and drinks from the deckchairs. Can recommend the Thai Chicken Salad and Calamari Salad. The spa centre in the hotel is lovely. More expensive than spas or salons on some of the main streets but to be expected and also a step above in terms of beautiful rooms, music, the works.Our Deluxe room was lovely though no drawers and issues with shower water draining out properly sometimes. Also the equipment in the gym died once or twice and air conditioning not very effective, but good equipment, TV available etc.Service good and certainly very polite and attentive staff. Service with a smile. Great buffet breakfasts and loved the Happy Hour (5-7pm two for one)My friend and I are happy to recommend. And make sure you look at the new website not just ---.com as ---.com.au is the new one.
Reviews.Author: balihigh

Reviews.Content: Great place!       Deluxe room with king size bed
Reviews.Author: elnido1999

Reviews.Content: I love this place! I have stayed at the Niksoma twice and cannot speak highly enough about it. Great location, fantastic staff.Approx 50 rooms, so if you like an intimate hotel, this is perfect.Within walking distance to Kuta and some of the great restaurants in Legian. Beach front with 2 beautiful pools overlooking the beach.Breakfast is sensational, love those banana pancakes!.I also tried the spa there, which would have to rank in my top 3. More expensive than Body Works, but no comparison.
Reviews.Author: chris68

Reviews.Content: Fabulous!!       Pool
Reviews.Author: felmingham

Reviews.Content: Perfect for our Honeymoon!! WOW what an amazing hotel. We were greeted with drinks and towels after 17hrs travelling but was it worth it. This is a lovely boutique hotel and the staff and food is amazing. The only down fall is its quite away from the main part of Legian but was perfect for our first week. We then moved to Tuban which was a little more lively.I would definately reccommed this hotel to anyone you are treated liked Royalty!!!
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Ng

Reviews.Content: my absolute favourite I travel to Bali 2 to 3 times a year, and last year was fortunate enough to stumble apon the Bali Niksoma. I have stayed at many places around kuta, legian and tuban, but the niksoma is my absolute favourite.I have stayed at the niksoma 4 times in the past 10 months, and now the thought of staying anywhere else scares me. The accomodation is excellent, as are the facilities. It is small enough to still be very personal, and big enough to have all you need. The food is excellent, the pools are great, and the staff are first rate. I could not fault the hotel. Looking forward to getting back there in November. It is perfectly situated on the beach, and far enough away from the hustle and bustle of kuta. We always feel very safe at the Niksoma. Love it!!!!!! I must say though that if you have trouble getting around, the niksoma would probably not be for you, there are alot of stairs, and the pools are both rather deep, at 5foot 6inches, I can only just stand up in them.
Reviews.Author: shitson

Reviews.Content: absolutley fantastic BAli Niksoma is a fantastic spot. Across from the beach at legian, close to great shopping and the hotel food and staff are excellent.Only thing about the Niksoma is that it is hard to get it to. So you have to book fairly well ahead of time.The rooms are great for familys. Interconnecting rooms only come in DEluxe suites, not standard rooms. SO if you have a family and want interconnecting you have to have Deluxe. These come with DVD players and TV's.Would stay there again. No Question.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Niksoma was great Just returned for five day at the Niksoma..great location and good hotel, although I recommend you stay in a Junior Suite for that little something extra...really friendly staff, only drawback was that only Australians were staying there, would be nice to have a mix of nationalities...although it did seem that it was really only Australians who are currently travelling to Bali at the moment, hopefully that will change soon.Definately recommend this hotel as the place to stay in Legian
Reviews.Author: wally1

Reviews.Content: lovely boutique hotel In may 2005 we stayed at the niksoma beach hotel for 5 nights. On arrival we were greeted some smiling balinese faces. The service provided by the staff at this hotel is just wonderful. We had booked a junior suite and were given an upgrade to a full suite which was very nice. The rooms are of a modern balinese style as they have all been renovated just recently. The pool and dining area are all very nice but could have a bit more shade so that you can get out of the tropical sun when near the pool and a bit more grass so that you do not burn your feet on the concrete when swimming. If you are early enough you can get one of the balinese bales that are very good for sleeping on during the day. I could strongly recommend eating at the hotel as the food is excellent and well priced. On a downside as much as we did enjoy staying at the niksoma i don't think that we would stay again because it is a long way from the shops and other nearby restaurants as it is a bit out of the way.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: excelente   showReview(22540427, 'full');
Reviews.Author: viajeros08
